discovered.name: Liberation Veteran Services
discovered.description: Comprehensive homeless veteran services including emergency shelter, transitional housing, case management, mental health and substance abuse treatment, employment training, and permanent housing assistance. Houses up to 38 veterans with 86% success rate to permanent housing.
discovered.notes: Operates low-demand program. Veterans Village Phase 1 now open with 50 micro apartments.

discovered.name: HomeAgain Richmond - Veteran Transitional Housing
discovered.description: Comprehensive homeless services organization with two emergency shelters. Provides transitional housing with intensive case management focused on securing and maintaining permanent housing. Partner with VA Medical Center.
discovered.notes: Operating since 1979. Works on McGuire Hospital campus in partnership with VA.

discovered.name: SupportWorks Housing - SSVF Program
discovered.description: Federal SSVF rapid rehousing program providing emergency rental assistance to veterans and families facing homelessness. Offers case management, benefits assistance, employment support, transportation, and financial planning.
discovered.address: 1900 Cool Lane, Suite B, Richmond, VA 23223
discovered.notes: Serves 15-county region including Richmond metro. Direct intake available without housing hotline referral.

discovered.name: CARITAS Men's Emergency Shelter
discovered.description: Richmond's largest emergency shelter providing beds and case management for homeless adults. Serves up to 36 men per night with case management focused on housing stabilization.
discovered.notes: Part of Greater Richmond Continuum of Care system. Accepts homeless individuals including veterans.

discovered.name: VA Richmond - Health Care for Homeless Veterans (HUD-VASH)
discovered.description: Federal VA homeless services providing HUD-VASH voucher coordination, case management, clinical services, and health care for homeless veterans. Primary entry point for HUD-VASH program.
discovered.notes: Primary federal contact for HUD-VASH. Veterans must be within reasonable distance from VAMC.

discovered.name: Virginia Career Works - Henrico Center
discovered.description: Primary workforce development center offering job referral, job training, job placement assistance, resume building, interview prep. DVOP and LVER specialists available for veterans.
discovered.notes: DVOP (Disabled Veterans Outreach Program) and LVER specialists available.

discovered.name: Virginia Career Works - Richmond West Center
discovered.description: Workforce development center offering comprehensive employment services including job training, placement, and veteran-specific support programs.
discovered.notes: Part of Virginia Employment Commission network.

discovered.name: Virginia Department of Veterans Services - Employment & Transition
discovered.description: State agency overseeing veteran employment, transition services, and workforce development initiatives. Manages V3 (Virginia Values Veterans) program for employers and transitioning service members.
discovered.notes: Coordinates Virginia's statewide veteran employment network and V3 Transition initiative.

discovered.name: Fort Gregg-Adams Employment Readiness Program
discovered.description: Comprehensive transition employment program for military personnel, spouses, retirees, and families. Offers career counseling, resume writing, interview preparation, and direct job placement support.
discovered.notes: Also offers Soldier for Life-Transition Assistance Program (SFL-TAP). Near Richmond.

discovered.name: DAV Virginia - Employment Program
discovered.description: Peer-to-peer employment assistance program specifically for disabled veterans. Provides job search resources, career assessments, resume preparation, interview coaching, and job fair access.
discovered.notes: Coordinates with VEC, DVOP, and LVER specialists. Sponsors job fairs with RecruitMilitary.

discovered.name: American Legion Virginia - Veteran Services
discovered.description: Veterans service organization providing accredited service officer assistance with benefits, education, and employment resources. Offers no-cost veteran support services.
discovered.notes: Provides expert, no-cost assistance through accredited service officers.
